title: Definitions
context: PART XXIX. STATEWIDE NEWBORN HEARING SCREENING PROGRAM Revision Note In this part, &ldquo;part&rdquo; substituted for &ldquo;chapter&rdquo;. [ยง321-361] Definitions. As used in this part, unless the context clearly indicates otherwise: &ldquo;Department&rdquo; means the department of health. &ldquo;Hearing-impaired infant&rdquo; means an infant who has an impairment that is a dysfunction of the auditory system of any type or degree sufficient to interfere with the acquisition and development of speech and language skills. &ldquo;Infant&rdquo; means a child from birth to thirty-six months of age. &ldquo;Management&rdquo; means the habilitation of the hearing-impaired infant. &ldquo;Screening&rdquo; means a test or battery of tests administered to determine the need for a professional examination. [L 1990, c 85, pt of ยง3]
